title: SMTP port 587 STARTTLS
content:
Hello,

After the automatic update of Thunderbird Destkop (Windows 10) to version 1.140.0 and then a manual update to 141.0, I cannot send emails using port 587 with STARTTLS (e.g., for an account hosted at smtp.office365.com).

Sending mail from other accounts via port 465 using SSL/TLS still works. Also, using an older version for Linux with the same setting for port 587 works.


Does anyone else experience a similar problem? Has there been a change in the implementation of STARTTLS?


Markus

Google Business Support Team

Dear Google Support Team,

I am writing to report an issue regarding my business listing for Sparsh Body Spa (website: https://www.sparshbodyspa.com). Although my business is verified and appears on Google Search and Maps, the phone number is not visible/live in the listing.

This issue is affecting our customer outreach and business inquiries significantly, especially since we offer wellness and massage services, where direct phone calls are essential for appointment bookings.

Business Details: Business Name: Sparsh Body Spa

Website: https://www.sparshbodyspa.com

Location: Delhi, India

Google Business Profile Name (Full Body Spa & Body Massage in Delhi, Rohini - Sparsh

Phone Number: 8744941093 I kindly request your support to review and resolve this issue at the earliest so that our contact number can be properly displayed on Google Search and Google Maps listings.

Please let me know if any verification or documentation is required from our end.

Thank you for your assistance.

title: Newly created mail account doesn't work
content:
I have a Google Workspace account and am trying to use Thunderbird as an email client.

If I let Thunderbird figure out the settings it will fail to recognize imap.gmail.com and smtp.gmail.com as the server.

I'm on a Mac M1 running macOS 15.5 The Thunderbird version is the latest at 115.10. Neither the hardware, the OS version, or Thunderbird seem to matter to the issue at hand, as described below. What seems to matter is the fact that I have multiple mail accounts on my Thunderbird.

When I do the manual setup and click 'Re-test' I get the "The following setting were found by probing the given server" on a green background, screenshot also attached.

However, after clicking on 'Done' I'm getting the "Unable to login at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." Screenshot also attached.

If I do Advanced config with what I know to be correct settings the account is not functional, I cannot see any email that's on the server and cannot send email.

I know the mail settings to be correct and the mail server to work properly because if I setup Thunderbird from scratch on a Linux or macOS machine, everything works as expected.

In the prefs.js file I can see multiple entries for mail.smtpserver.smtp*.username with the same value ("virgil@sproutwyze.com"), definitely from the multiple attempts to create a functional mail account. This shouldn't matter though since only one of those smtp server appears in "mail.smtpservers".

Lastly, I have upgraded Thunderbird to 128.13.0esr hoping for a different outcome. Alas, the behavior is the same though logging information sent to the error console is much better. NOTE: for the manual setup there is nothing on the error console when I press on the 'Done' button.

Any suggestions for how to fix the problem? Thank you.
creator: virgil7

title: Multiple inboxes not displaying on "Unified Folders" - showing on "All Folders"
content:
I have just set up Thunderbird with a handful of email accounts.

All inboxes show in the "All Folders" panel block, but when "Unified Folders" block is selected, the accounts prefixed "Intuition" fail to show in the panel. The Unified Inbox DOES receive mail from these hidden accounts, but this isn't really good enough as I need to be able to browse in to the folders within these accounts regularly.

Having both Unified and All views up is a workaround, but with 10+ accounts it takes up the full length of the screen when collapsed and is not the ideal setup.
